intro: Oxychlamys, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. Oxychlamys species are native to regions in Africa, particularly in the southern parts of the continent. They are often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing their adaptability to arid environments. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral structures and growth habits.
